alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; Clay; Clinton; Jackson; Lafayette; Ray (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 27 at 2:58AM CST by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Clinton, Clay, Ray, southwestern Caldwell, northwestern Lafayette and Jackson Counties through 330 AM CST... At 258 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Smithville to Sugar Creek to Lee`s Summit. Movement was northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kansas City, Independence, Lee`s Summit, Blue Springs, Liberty, Grain Valley, Excelsior Springs, Smithville, Kearney, Richmond, Greenwood, Lexington, Sugar Creek, Buckner, Lawson, Plattsburg, Lathrop, Lake Lotawana, Claycomo and Courtney. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Missouri between mile markers 11 and 33. Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 12 and 50. Interstate 470 between mile markers 7 and 16. Interstate 435 between mile markers 42 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Caldwell; Clay; Clinton; Jackson; Lafayette; Ray
